metadata.synopsis: Harper leader after the fight with the Drider. You started the fight on drider's side, but switched and sided with the Harpers. They take the lantern and if you want it, you need to attack them or convince them to give it to you.
metadata.how_to_trigger: After Ambush with Harper path:- Go to Region: Haven -> Bridge- set Act 2 Thiefling Path- pass the entrance cinematic- Go to Region: Haven -> Isobel Room- talk to Isobel -> Initiate Attack by Marcus- talk to Harper at goto -48, 135- SetGlobalOsirisFlag SCL_Drider_State_HarpersWaitingAtBridge- talk to Harpers on the bridge- follow them to Ambush site goto 0, -27- debug: Kill Combat- Talk to Harper (Branthos)After Ambush with Drider path:- go to Region: SCL -> Mountain Pass- set Act 2 Absolute Path- goto 92.91, 51.44, -50.63- talk to Kansif, perform the Lyre- talk to Drider- follow the Drider to Ambush site goto 14, -18- enter Combat, but Kill Drider- talk to the Harper (take the lantern or let Harper take the lantern).

20.speaker: Harper Branthos
20.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.

80.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.

30.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

3.speaker: Harper Branthos
3.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in player's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Player stows the lantern.

57.text: You. Don't move a godsdamned muscle.
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.

25.speaker: Harper Branthos
25.text: You. Don't move a godsdamned muscle.
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.

48.text: Talk. Why in the hells would a cultist turn on his kind?
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

47.speaker: Harper Branthos
47.text: Talk. Why in the hells would a cultist turn on their kind?
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *You notice a pin on the man's chest, identical to the one you found in Grymforge. He is a Harper.*
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: *The pin the man wears is familiar to you. He belongs to the Harpers, a covert organisation dedicated to freedom and balance.*
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

44.text: *The pin the man wears is familiar to you. He belongs to the Harpers, a covert organisation dedicated to freedom and balance.*
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *The pin the man wears is familiar to you. He belongs to the Harpers, a covert organisation dedicated to freedom and balance.*
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I'm not one of them. They took me prisoner.
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

5.speaker: Harper Branthos
5.text: A prisoner? Then I must be a welcome sight indeed.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

81.text: Give me the lantern, and follow. I know a refuge from the darkness. You can rest there.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands lantern to Harper, who takes it and puts it in inventory. Fine to show only basic upper-body motions.

79.speaker: Harper Branthos
79.text: Give me the lantern, and follow. I know a refuge from the darkness. You can rest there.
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands lantern to Harper, who takes it and puts it in inventory. Fine to show only basic upper-body motions.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: What sort of refuge do you mean?
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands lantern to Harper, who takes it and puts it in inventory. Fine to show only basic upper-body motions.

52.speaker: Harper Branthos
52.text: An inn - Last Light, it's called. A place you can sigh without the shadow-beasts hearing.

43.speaker: Player
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands lantern to Harper, who takes it and puts it in inventory. Fine to show only basic upper-body motions.

82.speaker: Harper Branthos
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands lantern to Harper, who takes it and puts it in inventory. Fine to show only basic upper-body motions.

77.speaker: Harper Branthos
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands lantern to Harper, who takes it and puts it in inventory. Fine to show only basic upper-body motions.

74.speaker: Harper Branthos
74.text: Let the lantern's light be your guide. I'll mark your map, should you lose the way.

32.text: No lantern? Damnable cultist. Only a fool would play your bloody games.

42.speaker: Harper Branthos
42.text: No lantern? Damnable cultist. Only a fool would play your bloody games.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Sorry. I don't have it anymore.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: How about I just kill you and keep the lantern for myself?

15.speaker: Harper Branthos
15.text: Follow me. I know a refuge from the darkness. You can rest there.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I will make my way there in my own time.

56.speaker: Harper Branthos
56.text: A dangerous choice - but yours to make. I will mark your map.

11.speaker: Harper Branthos
11.text: But don't linger for long. The shadows are not known to take pity.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: My goddess protects me. I'll make my own way there.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I couldn't bear the atrocities committed in the Absolute's name.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

34.speaker: Harper Branthos
34.text: By the Nine Hells, is that right? Then you are quite the curiosity.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I succumbed to their temptations. You gave me an opportunity to escape.
87.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

9.speaker: Harper Branthos
9.text: An cultist apostate - I reckon one of a kind. Curious.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I'm infected with their parasite, but I'm seeking a cure.

68.speaker: Harper Branthos
68.text: Jaheira's godsend. Such strange company you keep.
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.NodeContext: Very suspicious

14.speaker: Harper Branthos
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

1.speaker: Harper Branthos
1.text: Then I can only apologise. I was not aware of this mission.
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

64.speaker: Harper Branthos
64.text: Then I can only apologise. I was not aware of this mission.
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

66.speaker: Harper Branthos
66.text: The lantern is yours - Jaheira's orders. Take it, and it will guide your way to the Towers.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper hands player the Moonlantern

18.speaker: Harper Branthos
18.text: The lantern is yours to keep - Jaheira's said as much. It will guide your way to the Towers.

63.speaker: Harper Branthos
63.text: But remember: you don't just fight shadows. You fight what hides inside.

8.text: Your mission is fiction, snake - and Harpers do not ally with liars. We silence them.

49.speaker: Harper Branthos
49.text: Your mission is fiction, snake - and Harpers do not ally with liars. We silence them.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: The cult took me prisoner. Thank the gods you came when you did.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

37.speaker: Harper Branthos
37.text: We've done only as duty dictates.
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

26.speaker: Harper Branthos
26.text: We've done only as duty dictates.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

59.text: You were no prisoner - and I am no fool. Your lies end here, rat.

31.speaker: Harper Branthos
31.text: You were no prisoner - and I am no fool. Your lies end here, rat.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I'm not here to explain myself - I just want the lantern. Hand it over, or die.

21.speaker: Harper Branthos
21.text: Go on. Take the beast's lantern.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lifts lantern into the air. Its glow illuminates his face,

36.speaker: Harper Branthos
36.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lifts lantern into the air. Its glow illuminates his face,

17.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lifts lantern into the air. Its glow illuminates his face,

58.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

70.speaker: Harper Branthos
70.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in Harper's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Harper stows the lantern.

41.speaker: Harper Branthos
41.text: A pleasure to keep my weapon stayed for once. Go on, the lantern's yours.

50.speaker: Harper Branthos
50.text: Extraordinary. You strike even truer than I'd expected.

72.speaker: Harper Branthos
72.text: Extraordinary. You strike even truer than I'd expected.

51.speaker: Harper Branthos
51.text: It's time you seize what's yours. Check the drider - take the lantern.

75.speaker: Harper Branthos
75.text: A tongue of pure silver. Take the lantern from the drider - you've earned it.
